titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Council on Southeast Asia Studies, Yale University, Records
Council on Southeast Asia Studies, Yale University, Records
titlestmt.author: compiled by Daniel Hartwig

publicationstmt.publisher: Yale University. Department of Manuscripts and Archives

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Saturday September 29, 2018 at 10:11

did.unittitle: Council on Southeast Asia Studies, Yale University, records

repository.corpname: Yale University. Department of Manuscripts and Archives

did.abstract: The records consist of correspondence, subject files, student and faculty files, and printed material documenting Professor Harry J. Benda's directorship of the Southeast Asia Studies program at Yale. Also included are files of Karl J. Pelzer, chairman of the Council on Southeast Asia Studies.

odd.head: General note
odd.p: Forms part of Yale Record Group 3-C (YRG 3-C), Records of Yale academic divisions, councils, and committees.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: While this collection as a whole is available for research, parts of it may be restricted due to law, university policy or fragility. Any restricted material will be noted as such.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Council on Southeast Asia Studies, Yale University, Records (RU 598). Manuscripts and Archives, Yale University Library.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The records are arranged in two series: I. Correspondence, 1949-1973. II. Subject Files, 1942-1972; and subsequent accessions.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The records consist of correspondence, subject files, student and faculty files, and printed material documenting Professor Harry J. Benda's directorship of the Southeast Asia Studies program at Yale. Also included are files of Karl J. Pelzer, chairman of the Council on Southeast Asia Studies.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The materials are open for research.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The materials are open for research, with the exception of materials in boxes 26-28, which is restricted due to University policy until January 1, 2046.
